results.title: Moving Out
results.brief_description: Being a teenager can be hard enough. Being an Italian teenager in a very Australian suburb can be impossible! Gino wants to be Australian. After all, we’re all new Aussies, some are just newer than others. Gino doesn’t give up and when he has finally won the friendship of his Australian mates, it’s time to move out!

results.title: Le Choix des Armes
results.brief_description: The high walls of a prison. Two running shadows in the night, a parked Volvo car whose engine is running. Suddenly, the shrieking sound of an alarm hooter. Both men get hastily inside the car which starts immediately. A well directed drama about a retired gangster (Yves Montand) forced into an antagonistic relationship with a young punk. (Gerard Depardieu).

results.title: Grand illusion = La Grande illusion
results.brief_description: Jean Renoir’s classic study of men in war. The German victor and his captive officers in the close proximity of the prison camp become strangely impacted by the ironic contradictions of their situations. A deep respect develops between the German commander and his captive French officer, inter- woven with each other’s obligations to country and fellow-man. Cast includes Erich von Stroheim and Jean Gabin.

results.title: The Slim Dusty Movie
results.brief_description: The story of a man who believed in a dream and the woman who stood by his side. The story continues today in the outback, in the rodeo arenas of the west, the frontier towns, the highway truck stops, the aboriginal tribal lands of the Red Centre and the largest concert halls in Australia. Every year they wait for him; from Alice Springs to Sydney, from Kunnamulla to Gundagai. The call him “the man with his hat turned down in front” - the man who is Australia - Slim Dusty.

results.title: International Velvet
results.brief_description: The sequel to “National Velvet.” This is the moving story of Sarah (Tatum O’Neal) and her intense determination to win the Equestrian Three Day Event Gold Medal at the Olympic Games. Co-starring Christopher Plummer, Anthony Hopkins and Nanette Newman.

results.title: Variety
results.creator_credit: Bette Gordon, Channel Four, Variety Motion Pictures and Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen
results.brief_description: A young woman, an aspiring writer, gets a job selling tickets in a New York porno cinema. She becomes intrigued by the milieu and begins to follow one particular customer who travels around in a chauffer-driven limousine. Her initial fascination grows into obsession; in her imagination fantasy and reality become increasingly difficult to separate. While the filmmaker provides access to the film through the pleasures of narrative conventions she ultimately seeks to disrupt and reverse the roles and conventions of the thriller form in order to directly confront representations of sexuality and male/female desire, more specifically a woman’s developing fascination with her own sexuality. Christine’s fantasised position oscillates between the one who looks, the one who is looked at and the one who observes the voyeur.

results.title: The Peanut butter solution
results.brief_description: Nothing in 11 year old Michael Baskin’s vivid imagination can prepare him for the strange and enchanting adventure that he is about to embark on, an adventure that will change his life. Where an abandoned mansion holds a secret so frightening that it scares off little boys! Where friendly ghosts pass on magic potions made of peanut butter! Where an odd mystical artist paints pictures so real you can walk into them! And where magic and imagination are the most wonderful things of all. Rated: PG

results.title: 20,000 leagues under the sea
results.brief_description: Walt Disney’s entertaining epic version of Jules Verne’s nautical tale, stars James Mason as the evil, renegade Mastermind, Captain Nemo who pilots the fantastic submarine Nautilus on a memorable, adventure-filled journey beneath the seven seas.

results.title: The Boy who could fly
results.brief_description: This is a story of love and courage, filled with moments of great humour. A sensitive girl moves to a new neighbourhood and befriends the autistic and mysterious boy next door. He spends his day perched at his window, dreaming of flight. results.title: Robbery under arms
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Brampton and Pacific Photo Plays
results.brief_description: Based on the Rolf Boldrewood novel, this film follows the two Marsden brothers and their adventures with the gentlemanly bushranger, Captain Starlight; their romance with local girls, their life on the goldfields and their eventual capture by the police after Starlight is shot. The brothers serve a long prison term, and emerge to start a new life with their patiently waiting sweethearts. Cast includes Kenneth Brampton, Roy Redgrave, S.A. Fitzgerald, William Pearson, Stuart McCrae, Witton Power, Jackie Anderson, H.D. Wise, Tian Hogue, Nan Taylor, Phyllis Ruthcen, Hilda Dorrington, Vera Archer, Austral Nichol, Betty Crock. Reconstructed version by the National Film Archive (ScreenSound).
